values:
Just wanted to inform my adoring public that I am now a recording artist. LOL 

I work at a company that sells sweaters and knits. We've been doing a booming Christmas sweater business for the last few years. This year we have ones that make music/sing when you press them. To avoid copyright issues we use songs that are in the public domain which are most popular/common Christmas songs. Then a bunch of us get together in a closed office and record a stanza or 2 on someone's iphone. This is then mixed/whatever and the soundbyte sent to the factory. Those who participate, wether you sang or just shook some jingle bells has to sign a release form for the use of your recorded voice etc.
Happy Birthday Gaja!!! hope you have a wonderful day. Been slacking on LJ and social media in general, need to get back into the swing of things. :)

I am SO behind on seasonal/Christmas things! We literally just put the tree up last night , I just sent some international Christmas cards today, hopefully the rest by the end of the week. If I've sent you a card in the past and you have moved in the past year please let me know. I am screening comments.

There is stuff going that I've been meaning to post but tonight is the 1st Glee Beatles episode AND the Klaine proposal. I know they're young, but hey it's GLEE. ALL MY FEELS. ALL OF THEM. The song before this was All You Need Is Love, and when Blaine went around asking the other glee clubs to help, the song he sang was , of course, Help. lololol

My heart goes out to the people of Boston. Having lived through 9/11, seeing the videos of what happened today makes me sick to my stomach. I understand what the people of Boston are going through, there is shock and horror and the feeling that your city is NOT safe. I just want to give a massive hug to the city, being home to the Red Sox and all. Edited to add a link to ONTD_Political's good things post, filled with kittens and fluff.

So I was reading a fic the other day. One of the little background threads running through it was that since the main couple were expecting a baby, one of the parents was constantly suggesting DC/Marvel etc names for the baby which were shot down by the other main character because that character did not want a fandom name for the baby. However the character who kept suggesting names was actually gunning for a whedonverse name for the baby which he totally got because the other character did not realize that Alexander and the cute Xander nickname was from anything.

SO, if you had the chance and the desire to name your precious offspring after someone in fandom what/who would you pick?

The girls are marathoning LOTR as prep before watching The Hobbit sometime this break. I've tried to get them to watch the bass/rankin animated movie because I grew up on it really. Angelica has seen this version when she was younger and it kind of freaked her out a bit. I told them that during my childhood I'd been watching it annually since I was about 4/5. Angelica's response to this?

"That explains SO much."

LOL
Happy Thanksgiving to all on my Flist who celebrate it!

Thankfully we did not lose power although the internet is useless as the main offices are apparently in downtown Manhattan. I've been trying to keep up on my phone. Two parts of the fence in the backyard toppled over from the wind. The only reason we didn't get any water I'm the basement is because we didn't get much rain. 

The subways are not up because at least 7 tunnels are flooded. Partial bus service is back as I post this and should hopefully be completely back by tomorrow. My question is if express bus service will be running because that's the only way I'll be able to get to work. The kids have one more day off school because of the transit situation.

The pictures/Vid of the devastation to the Jersey shore is just heart wrenching. Atlantic city in particular, we go there at least once a year for a few days on the beach.

Turning in early and hopefully will be able to get to work in the morning.

It's getting really, really windy outside. Just glad that I don't live in an area that floods. Angelica's bff lives near the beach, on the 6th floor and she just texted that the air conditioner in her room-is set into the wall, below her window was blown in by the wind. Her dad is trying to patch up the hole. Idek So far we are good, lights still on, phone/internet still going. Schools have been declared closed for tomorrow and since the subway will not be up yet, no work either.

The kids made a snack run at the local grocery store before frankenoreastercane Sandy shuts everything down. We have the staples, milk, water, bread, etc.What made them do this is the discovery that there are no chocolate chip cookies left in the house for tomorrow. Lol

Anyway when they got to the store there were a small group of people and a store clerk outside.Apparently there were so many people inside that they would be let in when people left the store. Angelica said there was no bread/rolls left. Stacy said it was like the zombie apocalypse was coming. A friend of hers had texted her earlier that there were tons of people at the same store when they went. 

We were up at the crack of dawn this morning because Stacy had an audition for Angelica's high school at 8 and we were advised to get there early. We met up with 2 of her friends from dance class and saw another 2 from the studio, one who was trying out for vocal. 

The audition went well. She and her friends got called to interviews after the dance class which is a good sign. One audition down, about 3-4 more to go.

Mass transit is being shut down here starting at 7 tonight. No class for both kids tomorrow and obviously no work because I wouldn't be able to get there.

Everyone in the path of the storm stay safe.

Cell phone has been achieved! Well I recieved a phone that looks like my phone but now has to be tweaked and have stuff downloaded in order for it to look and feel and sound like my phone. I also am not sure whether I should be pleased at the convenience or freaked out that the play store remembers all the apps (ALL the apps) I have ever downloaded into any of my phones.

I have felt naked without my phone for the past few workdays.

Rewatching Legend of the Seeker. I comment that although the long, dangly parts on the sleeves of	Khalan's white dress look awesome they would so be a liability in an actual fight because someone could grab onto them. Angelica responds with, "you watch Glee." lol

We're going to the Global Citizen Festival concert thing this afternoon/night so we will miss Doctor Who tonight and ALL this particular episode entails. I mean we kind of know what happens somewhat but not the how or why and throw in weeping angels and ask my feels for this ep.omg Tissues at the ready.

I consider this my good deed for the month. LOL I am posting this link to lifehacker on "How to Block Annoying Political Posts on FB". I personally don't have one but I hope it works for those of you that do. On that note since it is the election season and I will most likely be posting stuff here I will LJ cut, have tags and it will be on the entry title that I'm doing a political post and if you are not interested, then you are free to scroll on by. ;)

"I'm mailing this tomorrow to save my uterus."

Angelica on mailing in her voter registration form. She registered online but has to mail it in as well.

I'm just going to rant a bit ok.
Stacy has nationals tomorrow. Basically just one number and the dance teacher had sent out numerous emails in June as to who could go etc.  My response had always been we'll be there as long as we have a ride there. Now the Friday before July 4th she let me know about one mom who had said she had room. The person I usually go with can't make it but another mother will take her kid. So I'm told to text the mother who had offered but she doesn't have a phone so we text her daughter's phone. Apparently that's how to contact her, fine, whatever. I text that Friday night. On Saturday I ask Stacy to text the daughter again. By Sunday I text another mother who is friends with her and am informed that she takes her time to answer but she'll get back to me. Monday I text the teacher and get the same response, she takes a while but she'll get back to me. Note I only texted her that Friday then Stacy followed up a few times the next day, so it's not like I was constantly texting her. By  Saturday I email the teacher that I haven't heard back from this lady. Monday, as in yesterday, I find out this lady has car trouble and will be riding with someone else as well. I find this out from Stacy who found out when she went to practice. This lady NEVER got back to me. I still am not sure who we're riding with tomorrow AND I'll be seeing this lady in about half an hour when I pick up Stacy and find out who we're riding with. I am about ready to throttle her but what with the politics of the dance studio I don't want any fallout, which is why I don't really stay at the studio much. I mean she's nice enough but i am never going to rely on her for anything EVER because really you can't even text me that you have car trouble? I would have had a week to look for another ride!
aaaaaaaaarrrrrrrggggghhjh
*grinding of teeth*

I'm at the hospital right now. Brought the hubby to the ER at 3AM because he had abdominal pain that radiated to his upper back. He had been suffering through the pain since 10:30 our so, convinced that it was just really bad gas. He's had x rays, a bedside sonogram, a CAT scan and now another ultrasound. We've been told he has gall stones and they are checking of he has an infection. The nurse told us that we're still here because we're waiting for a surgical consult, wether he needs it taken out. I'm going on about an hour's sleep and coffee.

My president.


". . . .You know, Malia and Sasha, they have friends whose parents are same-sex couples. There have been times where Michelle and I have been sitting around the dinner table and we’re talking about their friends and their parents and Malia and Sasha, it wouldn’t dawn on them that somehow their friends’ parents would be treated differently. It doesn’t make sense to them and frankly, that’s the kind of thing that prompts a change in perspective.”
From Huffpo.

♥_____♥ Mr. POTUS, ♥_____♥ .


Also surprisingly:

Shep Smith: GOP Is On ‘The Wrong Side Of History’ On Gay Marriage

Speaking shortly after President Obama announced his endorsement of same-sex marriage, Fox News anchor Shepard Smith suggested that Republicans were on “the wrong side of history” when it comes to the issue.

“I am curious whether you believe in this time of rising debt and medical issues and all the rest, if Republicans would go out on a limb and try to make this a campaign issue while sitting very firmly without much question on the wrong side of history,” he asked reporter Ed Henry.

Originally posted by at Mississippi Personhood Amendment
Okay, so I don't usually do this, but this is an issue near and dear to me and this is getting very little no attention in the mainstream media.

Mississippi is voting on November 8th on whether to pass Amendment 26, the "Personhood Amendment". This amendment would grant fertilized eggs and fetuses personhood status.

Putting aside the contentious issue of abortion, this would effectively outlaw birth control and criminalize women who have miscarriages. This is not a good thing.

Jackson Women's Health Organization is the only place women can get abortions in the entire state, and they are trying to launch a grassroots movement against this amendment. This doesn't just apply to Mississippi, though, as Personhood USA, the group that introduced this amendment, is trying to introduce identical amendments in all 50 states.

What's more, in Mississippi, this amendment is expected to pass. It even has Mississippi Democrats, including the Attorney General, Jim Hood, backing it.

The reason I'm posting this here is because I made a meager donation to the Jackson Women's Health Organization this morning, and I received a personal email back hours later - on a Sunday - thanking me and noting that I'm one of the first "outside" people to contribute.

So if you sometimes pass on political action because you figure that enough other people will do something to make a difference, make an exception on this one. My RSS reader is near silent on this amendment. I only found out about it through a feminist blog. The mainstream media is not reporting on it.

If there is ever a time to donate or send a letter in protest, this would be it.

What to do?

- Read up on it. Wake Up, Mississippi is the home of the grassroots effort to fight this amendment. Daily Kos also has a thorough story on it.

- If you can afford it, you can donate at the site's link.

- You can contact the Democratic National Committee to see why more of our representatives aren't speaking out against this.

- Like this Facebook page to help spread awareness.

This Slate article basically goes into how he shaped our world. While watching Nightline last night, this little boy, a tween really, stated how Steve Jobs was a wizard in a world full of muggles. That really does sum it up.
Angelica was in an elevator and she heard a zshoomzshoomzshoom sound. Her first reaction was to wonder where was the TARDIS.

Just a quick post to say we're ok. A little water in the basement, part of the wooden fence in the back ripped off the wire fence behind it but other than that we're good. I haven't gone out so not sure what trees in the neighborhood went down. I'm just glad the big tree in my neighbor's yard (it's right next to the fence at the back of our yard is ok and no branches came down (which would have taken down all the telephone/etc wires). Also glad that the tree in front of my next door nghbor's house just shed a lot of leaves but otherwise is fine. We didn't lose power thankfully. My only concern now is how the subways will be running tomorrow morning.

The people I've heard from seem to have gotten through ok as well.

Taken from Tumblr because it is ACCURATE

THINGS YOU NEED

  1. APPROPRIATE COMFORTABLE CLOTHING
    Whether you’re in your Hogwarts uniform, dressed up as a Snitch or even just a Harry Potter t-shirt, make sure they’re comfortable. Make sure it’s easy to store/hide as well… It’s awesome that you made a 2ft tall lion head for you to wear as Luna, but you NEED to remember that when you go into the cinema, you’ll need to take it off and store it somewhere so people can see past your head.
  2. A WAND
    Oh come on, it’s self-explanatory.
  3. TISSUE BOX
    Don’t even lie. You will need it. Don’t skimp on it and get a cheapo tissue box either. Get one with the highest number of plys. And if you’re planning to share it with other people (though I’m pretty sure most of us will need a box per person), get one that isn’t scented - you never know if they’re allergic or not!
  4. WATER
    You’ll be crying a lot - therefore, you’ll need to be well hydrated.
  5. FOOD
    If you get food at the cinema, that’s fine. But if it’s anything like Australian cinema, be prepared to pay something like $15 just for a bucket of popcorn. Make sandwiches, bring fruits and nuts - less sugar means the less you’ll crash half way through the movie.
  6. YOUR CAFFEINE OF CHOICE
    Whether it’s coffee, coke or red bull. Don’t drink too much of it - as caffeine is a diuretic. Which means, it makes you urinate more than usual. You don’t want to get up while Neville is killing Nagini on screen and annoy everyone else as you go pass them so you can go pee.
  7. MONEY
    Some cinemas sell merchandise. Also, why did you leave your house without at least a few dollars in your pocket? 
  8. YOUR TICKET
    Laugh all you want, I’ve seen people that has left their tickets at home before!

THINGS YOU MAY BRING

  1. DEATHLY HALLOWS BOOK
    If you’re waiting in line for hours at a time, you may want to bring the Deathly Hallows book to refresh your memory.
  2. PILLOW
    Sitting on hard ground while waiting sucks. Also you can take nanna naps. 

THINGS YOU CAN LEAVE AT HOME

  1. EYE MAKE UP
    Unless you want to leave the theatre looking like a panda, I suggest you don’t put any on. 

AND MOST IMPORTANTLY, MAKE NEW FRIENDS AND JUST HAVE FUN!

Brazil's Supreme Court on Thursday recognized the legal rights of same-sex partners in "stable" civil unions, Chief Justice Cezar Peluso announced.

The 10 justices unanimously ruled that partners in a same-sex union had the same legal rights as a man and woman in a marriage.

"Those who opt for a homosexual union cannot be treated less than equally as citizens," Justice Camen Lucia said.

I am reading the post/comments that   linked to and just realized that approximately 3 years ago this week, I became a TH fan. I was reading this article , watched the linked vids, made sure I watched the livefeed of their EMA Monsoon performance and have not looked back.

My 3 year anniversary on LJ is coming up at the end of this month because, guess what, I created an LJ just to be able to get to TH comms. LOL I did not do this for HP fandom, which really to that point had been my only other 'serious' fandom. Then again I had other places to go to follow HP discussions/news/fic. With TH fandom and having virtually no grasp of the German language I took the LJ plunge just to get info/gossip/ANYTHING TH really in English.

I have gotten so much in return. *hugs flist*

Originally posted by at Purple Wednesday
IT GETS BETTER

♥
It’s been decided. On October 20th, 2010, we will wear purple in honor of the 6 gay boys who committed suicide in recent weeks/months due to homophobic abuse in their homes at at their schools. Purple represents Spirit on the LGBTQ flag and that’s exactly what we’d like all of you to have with you: spirit. Please know that times will get better and that you will meet people who will love you and respect you for who you are, no matter your sexuality. Please wear purple on October 20th. Tell your friends, family, co-workers, neighbors and schools.

RIP Tyler Clementi, Seth Walsh
RIP Justin Aaberg, Raymond Chase
RIP Asher Brown and Billy Lucas

REBLOG to spread a message of love, unity and peace.

- original post by


*hunts down something purple to wear*

I had to make myself STOP. So much CUTE out there. I hope you enjoyed! :D

I am soooo upset. Remember my fridge is supposed to be delivered today? Guess what? No fridge for me. I got a call last night confirming delivery this morning, so far, so good. Delivery time passes so I call. Turns out that due to sloppy paperwork on the salesperson side the fridge did not get on the truck this morning. If I hadn't called, I would be what, waiting all day for nothing? I was furious. I had to reschedule for something that was not my fault. IDGAF argggh I am usually very easy going but when I do go off my family knows to take cover. The reschedule for tomorrow would not have bothered me but I have a lot to do tomorrow. I'd promised Stacy dimsum for a while now and we're doing it tomorrow. My niece is having a birthday party which we'll be at for 2 hours max coz we have to get to the museum Stacy took classes at to catch at least an hour of their reception. The kids artwork will be displayed in the education center.

I guess I was so upset on the phone that the manager is giving me back almost half of the fridge price since the whole thing is due to incompetance on their part. So I am scheduled for first delivery (9am) tomorrow.

Part of me feels horrible at getting upset on the phone like that, and that salesperson had been so helpful and nice and now he's probably going to be reprimanded for this.     ._.

Posted via LjBeetle
